1595AA03D53F49BDBCEDC2896D075C3D.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those in need through the corporal and spiritual works of
mercy.

6BC09E591F794382A8E9625E313F5551.description:
The Magisterium has given us guidance in the form of encyclicals
and letters to help us live just lives.

F8EB277E3E084E0A9FC480DD8B5B1290.description:
The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to
model our lives.

EA06894480A445D08D7C31F514B26639.description:
The Saints provide us with examples of how to live justly and with
compassion for others.

241003E1C2564006A0FC94FAE64A44F6.description: The Old Testament and New Testament both contain scriptural stories that guide the faithful in living lives of justice and mercy.

77491F9D5DDC4AD8AB09EE1F8C474609.description: The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the New Covenant.

59893CF0C3DF40E78CA362EF32E3D8DD.description:
JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS
DISCIPLES.

C3B8876189B043C2BFD7EFA2CA554DD5.description: The liturgy has undergone changes throughout the history of the Church in order to better serve the needs of the faithful.

4C74A09F240340D88502C8B4A50A0111.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and help the faithful to lead lives directed
towards Jesus Christ.

8EDE361D92514EADB9D1952F8E72EB2B.description:
The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday
Eucharistic Celebration, the central liturgical action of the
faithful.

BB0CAFA567064A98B4815282B5661548.description: The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to sanctify our days.

A2F2477685C147BCAC5EEBF43A148DBA.description:
The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work and prayer of the Liturgy of the
Hours. The Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of
the Church, prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

9F99C23F44954AB1B723087F65DA6DB9.description: LITURGY IS THE P.UBLIC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THE CHURCH.

D03EAD9D73AE4E2C9D66E02FBBFE5B5B.description:
The Cardinal Virtues are Prudence, Justice, Fortitude, and
Temperance. These human virtues are stable dispositions of the intellect and will that govern our acts, order our passions, and guide
our conduct in accordance with reason and faith.

415338D25EAF4A0FA9C3001F673C1D07.description: THE CARDINAL VIRTUES ARE THE HABITS THAT MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO THE THEOLOGICAL

64C94B57F19543C3A54F4765C98AF992.description: The Theological Virtues (Faith, Hope and Charity) are gifts infused by God into the souls of the faithful to make them  capable of acting as his children and meriting eternal life.

626E6B46A03D471B9CBA0FE093B5DF3D.description: THE THEOLOGICAL VIRTUES ARE NECESSARY TO LIVE A LIFE IN KEEPING WITH THE GOSPEL AND THE COMMANDS OF

94931DD05EF546CEB5107763DC04DFC2.description:
Hell is the state of definitive self-exclusion from communion with
God and the blessed. It is reserved for those who refuse by their own free choice to believe and be converted from sin, even to the
end of their lives. Hell's principal punishment consists of eternal
separation from God.

DE3043535E03475CA003B31E4340A787.description: HELL'S PRINCIPAL PUNISHMENT CONSISTS IN ETERNAL SEPARATION FROM GOD.

976C69834D874626BF9464DA34F64FF3.description: Beatific Vision is the contemplation of God in heavenly glory, a gift of God which is a constitutive element of the happiness (or beatitude) of heaven.

1D15CD04037D4CDFAE63CA63860F9736.description: Indulgence is the remission before God of the temporal punishment due to sin whose guilt has already been forgiven.

2539507AA8CE4D9CA0AEF7E99FAF9C57.description: In the Communion of Saints, all the faithful of Jesus Christ, those who are pilgrims on earth, those being purified, and the blessed in heaven share in a common fund of spiritual goods.

2D820D73797B4BB785B9F9CF04AFD516.description: THE CHURCH IS THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST.

8C9A72C9E2AD4A61ACE11DB76C899D5E.description:
During the missionary journeys of Saint Paul several letters were written by him. These letters now make up part of the New Testament
Canon.

DE4BCA15BB964AD49F04759A1A82E714.description: SAINT PAUL JOURNEYED TO SPREAD THE GOSPEL MESSAGE AMONG THE GENTILES. HE AUTHORED-MANY OF THE

5641193994974C1A893E0BA47FD96FBD.description:
Key events in the Acts of the Apostles provide a broad survey of the church's development from the resurrection of Jesus Christ to Paul's first Roman imprisonment and how the early Church
lived and shared in community.

9E042ACE9A8546258B7CEF955395216B.description: THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES TELLS THE STORY OF THE EARLY CHURCH.

E1812F30257941F4B57D3C7E85CD0FDE.description: The seven gifts of the Holy Spirit are wisdom, understanding, counsel, fortitude, knowledge, piety, and fear of the Lord.

5F0E3497518F4A548C8D534033C813AF.description:
The Holy Spirit is always guiding the Church in the Magisterium,
Liturgy, in the witness of the saints and in the whole work of salvation.

592572EEFE7940DA8C7446C186AB7FEB.description:
The Holy Spirit is the third divine Person of the Blessed Trinity,
the personal love of Father and Son for each other.

57EFB4F7ABC54E3B9262CFD8352D7B77.description: AT PENTECOST, THE HOLY SPIRIT, DESCENDED UPON THE DISCIPLES.

6817E68304B54BD69BCF7134DC7D27DA.description: Jesus Christ is at work in each of the Seven Sacraments. Sacraments confer the grace they signify, and each has form and matter.

3FCEAB1FB4A546C7A237E19C270C8CD2.description: THE SACRAMENTS WERE INSTITUTED BY JESUS CHRIST AND ENTRUSTED TO THE CHURCH~

275EAB42A5E74E7294F1F334F03E9BC8.description:
Jesus Christ shows the power, forgiveness, and the compassion
of God through the miracles He performs.

A2D5E3F38415443DBD8036A360055E88.description: Jesus Christ heals the sick and forgives sinners, calling all to repentance.

135CD92172614AC7B4B0E6933C3F100A.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE LAMB OF GOD WHO TAKES AWAY THE SINS OF THE WORLD.

9E3D6657242F4E4591832A42F73027C8.description: Jesus Christ taught about the end of the world, the Second Coming, the General Judgment and the Resurrection of the Dead.

6274B03A9C194022BC217CBE33A0B0A5.description: The Beatitudes were given by Jesus Christ in the Sermon on the Mount to help people live according to the values of the Kingdom of Heaven.

58D7F7BDCC644D249632BA65CD87CCBA.description: Jesus Christ taught in parables to provide the people with a new way of living God's call to love and forgiveness.

C1C4713DF9A0494894137B8A7547B005.description: JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT HIS DISCIPLES ABOUT THE KINGDOM OF GOD, HOW TO PRAY, LIVE, SERVE AND LOVE.

BF2FC008336345418E441128AB25AE87.description:
Infallibility is the gift of the Holy Spirit to the Church whereby the pope/ pastors of the Church and bishops in union with him, can definitively
proclaim a doctrine of faith or morals for the belief of the faithful.

8FA2752110CB480D996094E560B93E7F.description:
The Pope is the Bishop of Rome, St. Peter's successor, and the
Church's supreme pastor.

82AFAD7EB4664FA0AA7DF833E0851077.description:
JESUS CHRIST MADE SIMON, SON,OF JOHN, WHOM HE NAMED PETER, THE ROCK OF HIS CHURCH AND SHEPHERD OF
THE WHOLE FLOCK.

35A7A0448E1546659B7853C25B5250BD.description: The Church is one, holy, catholic, and apostolic.

CE47C19FE72C4DFE98E03C338D0D5CAE.description: THE CHURCH WAS FOUNDED BY JESUS CHRIST AND IS RECOGNIZED BY THE FOUR MARKS OF THE CHURCH.

C4040BAA7F084B64BC5684F25B002E3C.description:
The bishops have by divine institution taken the place of the apostles as pastors of the Church to collaborate the work they
had begun, to tend the whole flock. The Holy Spirit guides the
bishops in shepherding The Church of God.

C4E29898C7FA42B8BC3E34A7624BD7B6.description: Jesus Christ summoned to himself Twelve Apostles and gave them the power and authority to act in his Name.

6E084E9A6EFE425C87A44391847284F4.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLED HIS DISCIPLES TO FOLLOW HIM.

3790669FB1A245BE84D0FF766EAB4C65.description: The books of the New Testament are each classified into a literary genre.

4FF69BE055984B6A8615E7F2ABAB88A9.description: THERE ARE 27 BOOKS IN THE NEW TESTAMENT, INCLUDING GOSPELS, ACTS, LETTERS, AND REVELATION.

B4A72DE44CE94F44BAE38540DAEC1985.description:
The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ can be found in all four
Gospels.

C9E86B2B6BC647B7B2476FFC170B3DF2.description:
JESUS CHRIST'S PASSION, RESURRECTION, AND ASCENSION ARE THE HIGH POINT AND MAIN FOCUS OF ALL THE
GOSPELS.

07E14BCFC74847A393D174A5EDF4D9AA.description: The Synoptic Gospels and the Gospel of John each have a unique presentation of Jesus Christ.

B6084CB95E5042C19C369F556C8FE418.description: THE FOUR GOSPELS PROCLAIM THE LIFE, MINISTRY, MIRACLES AND TEACHINGS OF JESUS CHRIST.

A69BB2D1748A4C0EB1E021CBDDB99140.description:
The development of the New Testament canon resulted in 27 books. The four Gospels in the New Testament canon have
commonalities between them and particularities that make each
unique.

04D83D3FC0D04FF09AEE59F9E6690EB8.description:
The Gospel writers, the Evangelists, were inspired by God the
Holy Spirit to write the good news of our salvation.

4CFD85E2246448F6A72D7349F701DA8D.description:
THE HUMAN AUTHORS OF THE NEW TESTAMENT DEPEND PRIMARILY ON ORAL TRADITION ABOUT JESUS CHRIST AND
HIS FIRST FOLLOWERS.

23EEE09D7AF44CE9BE5A2F538D98ACC9.description: In Jesus Christ there is a unity of human nature and divine nature in the one divine person of the Son. God the Son is consubstantial with the Father.

82DE538C3AF74DD6B4E1D128E61300B9.description: In the Mystery of the Incarnation God the Son, the Word, became fully human without loss of His Godhead.

7BF3789735A040CCB963B75135D7AAF0.description: JESUS CHRIST IS TRUE GOD AND TRUE MAN

F69212C5407247BAB64C57BC1AD69352.description:
The Mystery of the Blessed Trinity is the center of Christian life
and belief.

85B43FBEF3B5430AA2D9431BC436C14D.description:
In the relational names of the persons the Father is related to the
Son, the Son to the Father, and the Holy Spirit to both. While they are called three persons in view of their relations, they are one
nature or substance.

ED4F7AC4E3BD4B27ADE0C61D2B42D55A.description:
JESUS CHRIST REVEALS THE INTER LIFE OF THE BLESSED TRINITY. GOD IS THREE EQUAL PERSONS, ONE DIVINE
NATURE OR GODHEAD.

E114C6F6DFD74D118E0238E4B062164F.description:
Christ is a translation into Greek from the Hebrew Messiah,
which means "anointed". It became the name proper to Jesus because he accomplished perfectly the divine mission of priest, prophet, and King, signified by his anointing as Messiah, "Christ".

64265AAC20134DB0AE65AE853F060BC0.description: Messiah is a Hebrew word meaning "anointed".

42CB37E6A30149F0B6A9A9B35EB3A39B.description: THE TITLE MESSIAH OR CHRIST MEANS ANOINTED ONE. THIS IS A TITLE AND ROLE, NOT A NAME.

83DFDB79EE4843EF925B83A5DE7961B1.description:
Jewish culture during the time of Jesus Christ had many
elements and components.

177802A03723447BBB7D61A4BB47324B.description:
The New Testament mentions several historical cities and places, as well as geographical features that can be located on a
map.

E8B13E28F0164373B97ED7166B7358D9.description: JESUS CHRIST WAS RAISED IN NAZARETH1AND WAS AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF HIS RELIGIOUS AND CULTURAL COMMUNITY.

67DEF66E00D34D7B94A2C168C220B89B.description: Catholic teaching regarding the singular vocation of the Blessed Virgin Mary is that she is the Mother of God.

D65E5868A7994F4D896C2DDCE9F4E54C.description: Mary is the Ever-Virgin Mother of God.

7861CE9CFB204A3BA1AF38F7F5640149.description:
MARY COOPERATED IN GOD'S PLAN FOR SALVATION. MARY'S FIAT AT ANNUNCIATION WAS HER UNCONDITIONAL YES TO
BECOMING THE MOTHER OF GOD.

373299F3FBAE40A79F2161B503E85380.description:
God sent his Son born of The Blessed Virgin Mary through which
we became his adopted children.

11D6E02A82654CC49CD90CE3A6BD513E.description: THE ONLY BEGOTTEN SON OF GOD WAS BORN OF WOMANITHROUGH WHOM WE BECAME HIS ADOPTED CHILDREN.

CD863CFC61A8478A96ADFE88D9B63F14.description: There are present in the Old Testament Scriptures types and prophecies regarding the Promised Savior.

0D808B85C69E4EA08BECB27CD7257415.description:
IN HIS PROVIDENCE, THROUGH THE HISTORY OF THE CHOSEN PEOPLE, IN TYPES (PRE-FIGUREMENTS) AND PROPHECY,
GOD PROMISES A REDEEMER.

343FB0E6BCD74630B7CC8B5599F0B2A7.description:
As a consequence of Original Sin man lost the grace of original holiness, and became subject to the law of death; sin became
universally present in the world. Human nature is described as
being in a fallen state.

FF77851208544866B3896703EE30AB9D.description:
The fall of the angels can be compared to the fall of man, behind the disobedient choice of our first parents lurks a seductive voice,
opposed to God, which makes them fall into death out of envy.

ED95069F02154872BD5E617626A4077F.description:
Original sin is the sin by which the first human beings disobeyed the commandment of God, choosing to follow their own will rather than
the will of God.

EAD18BD20A794262AFCD5F73512ACF32.description:
Sanctifying grace heals our human nature wounded by sin by giving us a share in the divine life of the Trinity. It is a habitual, supernatural
gift which continues the work of sanctifying us - making us "perfect",
holy, and Christlike.

ED97B84F968C41F1850A434C734A426E.description:
AFTER THE FALL, ALL HUMAN BEINGS STAND IN NEED OF REDEMPTION. THROUGH DISOBEDIENCE HUMANS LOST GOD'S
GRACE.

7A472FE2CE9F42B0B18C4DABBC2B51AB.description: The spiritual principle of human beings is the soul. The soul is the subject of human consciousness and freedom; soul and body together form one unique human nature. Each human soul  is individual and immortal, immediately created by God.

68D66854BEF74F889F417E027D44ED4E.description: The human person has both a physical and a spiritual dimension.

7C8C4C0620744C5F92A3DD4F93FA67A5.description: Human beings are created with a body and a soul.

2D41421D832E44A6BBA9E95507738985.description: The book of Genesis has two symbolic stories of creation that reveal God as the source of all life.

1D41A836B27C41F484D0AE4C875976CD.description: ALL THAT EXISTS, BOTH SEEN AND UNSEEN WAS CREATED THROUGH THE WORD.

F35EFF28B27241E4961F38CD4E285959.description: Scripture and Divine Tradition together make up a single deposit of faith.

E1ABDF2201DF49819C7E71FA07B49FC3.description: The living transmission by Holy Mother Church, accomplished in the Holy Spirit, is called Sacred Tradition.

74203EFFEA4F4004865A4EA3079585E3.description: The Canon of Scripture includes 46 books for the Old Testament and 27 for the New Testament.

B21DB3E96076411295394AF3B19B9284.description:
SACRED TRADITION AND SACRED SCRIP"FURE MAKE UP A SINGLE SACRED DEPOSIT OF THE WORD OF GOD, WHICH IS
ENTRUSTED TO THE CHURCH.

F408386F31B34D1CB43C6C9CF4C8F5DB.description: Several passages in the New Testament teach specifically on the redemption God gives us through Jesus Christ.

5C56AE789563411FA453E2282942C95F.description:
The Incarnation is the fact that the Son of God assumed human
nature and became man in order to accomplish our salvation in that same human nature. Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the second
Person of the Trinity, is both true God and true man, not part God and
part man.

97950A0E6DC74633935FFCD60B5E0037.description:
Revelation is God telling us about Himself, ourselves, and the world around us, and inviting us into relationship with Him. Divine Revelation
is relational and calls us to actively receive what God has first given.

15B2B4EE6ECA4B9FBD77DF08F617FD6B.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE FULL AND FINAL REVELATION OF GOD. HE IS THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD.

0D91A79ED1854DC99B54252E8760A831.description: Faith Theme: Jesus Christ, the Lord

9C0081683FEB4FB0994AEC7D48264343.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those in need through the
corporal and spiritual works of mercy.

0239E1DBA52248A39C51325699A46AD3.description: The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to model our lives.

52EA0961E79140EDAF80B224DCD7924A.description: The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the New Covenant.

2E16765BC1FB4BACA3A1498064FBAE80.description:
JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS
DISCIPLES.

AC57BCB6058A4E3E80A179811C029320.description: The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and help the faithful to lead lives directed towards Jesus Christ.

E48910EE18ED44ED8801120D1E16C545.description: The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday Eucharistic Celebration, the central liturgical action of the faithful.

5473D406B033482F943C40EB2F4C21DF.description: The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to sanctify our days.

F686A984607F4FCB8F7C8276CDAC2193.description: The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work and prayer of the Liturgy of the Hours. The Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of the Church, prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

1A4EA012876B486DA53EB47DD5E70E65.description: LITURGY IS THE PUBLIC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THI; CHURCH.

5C867B15CE5A4DA5BCB83721FA1F1635.description: The Theological Virtues (Faith, Hope and Charity) are gifts infused by God into the souls of the faithful to make them capable of acting as his children and meriting eternal life.

344BA06FCD7449A99B6FEED5CF0C2AEB.description:
THE THEOLOGICAL VIRTUES ARE NECESSARY TO LIVE A LIFE IN KEEPING WITH THE GOSPEL AND THE COMMANDS OF
JESUS CHRIST.

DBEBE3439145443698445970DA6B17ED.description:
Hell is the state of definitive self-exclusion from communion with God and the blessed. It is reserved for those who refuse by their own free choice to believe and be converted from sin, even to the end of their lives. Hell's principal punishment consists of eternal separation
from God.

A99E70B2BA4243E2AEEA309532181D0B.description: HELL'S PRINCIPAL PUNISHMENT CONSISTS IN ETERNAL SEPARATION1 FROM GOD.

406DEDFA28D74C8A89D81B2E5220433C.description:
Beatific Vision is the contemplation of God in heavenly glory, a gift of God which is a
constitutive element of the happiness (or beatitude) of heaven.

3D85C28B407249EABC2ACD5932D34367.description:
In the Communion of Saints, all the faithful of Jesus Christ, those who are pilgrims on earth, those being purified, and the blessed in heaven share in a common fund of spiritual 1.3.9
goods.

5E1E2CFA5BBF47B2BF998E5330253F82.description: THE CHURCH IS THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST.

0A118D5F953040A38DB653DBCE288FBC.description:
Key events in the Acts of the Apostles provides a broad survey of the church's development from the resurrection of Jesus Christ to Paul's first Roman imprisonment and
how the early Church lived and shared in community.

11D4E44041134B15B53B9B7129C33380.description: THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES TELLS THE STORY OF THE EARLY CHURCH.

73344D82B6C44832BAEE37D0A007ABFD.description: The seven gifts of the Holy Spirit are Wisdom, Understanding, Counsel, Fortitude, Knowledge, Piety, and Fear of the Lord.

13736E651EAB4DF2BD3C344A3CA872AD.description:
The Holy Spirit is the third divine Person of the Blessed Trinity, the personal love of Father
and Son for each other.

19A34CCC8F8B401199949882726E92DC.description: AT PENTECOST, THE HOLY SPIRIT, DESCENDED UPON THE DISCIPLES.

AFF86187E331421EA3C46802FE24F2AD.description:
Jesus Christ is at work in each of the Seven Sacraments. Sacraments confer the grace they 2.2.1-
signify, and each has form and matter.

9BD2AA6094E9440DBA1F13703D3226C4.description: THE SACRAMENTS WERE INSTITUTED BY JESUS CHRIST AND ENTRUSTED TO THE CHURCH.

B5C5504014444AE0AC599D9AD900A7AC.description:
Jesus Christ shows the power, forgiveness, and the compassion of God through the
miracles he performs.

4E9B39F09BD645628AD35CCF94612A0E.description: Jesus Christ heals the sick and forgives sinners, calling all to repentance.

C5E902A29269402390D88B4302BFFE37.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE LAMB OF GOD WHO TAKES AWAY THE SINS OF THE WORLD.

772B7AC34B984A09B59968B36BE5AF2F.description: Jesus Christ taught about the end of the world, the Second Coming, the General Judgment and the Resurrection of the Dead.

9F4291AD4A56467B9A72DFA0A3B208E8.description: The Beatitudes were given by Jesus Christ in the Sermon on the Mount to help people live according to the values of the Kingdom of Heaven.

4B6A5C2D83A84F00B14DCF5EF60B6E02.description: Jesus Christ taught in parables to provide the people with a new way of living God's call to love and forgiveness.

C468F845660A4595B92995EEE2CDA8EA.description: JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT HIS DISCIPLES ABOUT THE KINGDOM OF GOD, HOW TO PRAY, LIVE, SERVE AND LOVE.

B787CD9B31994864B6438D147932FE2E.description: The Pope is the Bishop of Rome, St. Peter's successor, and the Church's supreme pastor.

12B33F18EAE1491981737ED02D76F445.description: JESUS CHRIST MADE SIMON, SON·OF JOHN, WHOM HE NAMED PETER, THE ROCK OF HIS CHURCH AND SHEPHERD OF THE WHOLE FLOCK.

174F1CCD28AD4B3FB60FE3339B7F0A27.description: The Church is one, holy, catholic, and apostolic.

EE04329179234C98AC24C0F971039B6E.description: THE CHURCH WAS FOUNDED BY JESUS CHRIST AND IS RECOGNIZED BY THE FOUR MARKS OF THE CHURCH.

FFD21D3892254173ABF24A6ECA23FE58.description: The bishops have by divine institution taken the place of the apostles as pastors of the Church to collaborate the work begun, to tend the whole flock. The Holy Spirit guides the  bishops in shepherding the Church of God.

003A2EE1A32E427E84419B5C204E894B.description: Jesus Christ summoned to himself Twelve Apostles and gave them the power and authority 5.5.6 to act in his Name.

46186414C20A4BF189C60A48D20371DE.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLED HIS DISCIPLES TO FOLLOW HIM.

1E59EBCDB831482FB4B1C21CD327F0BE.description: The books of the New Testament are each classified into a literary genre.

6C6E3E4CD2E24A0281525F46BF18DA70.description: THERE ARE 2if BOOKS IN THE NEW TESTAMENT, INCLUDING GOSPELS, ACTS, LETTERS, AND REVELATl0N.

1064A308360B45B081DDC00F9639C2C4.description: The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ can be found in all four Gospels.

25A1C7D757FA4A11A670EB2E04110AB0.description:
JESUS CHRIST'S PASSION, RESURRECTION, AND ASCENSION ARE THE HIGH POINT AND MAIN FOCUS OF ALL THE
GOSPELS.

B19CB69DC9F04788A603EEDA8CC78B70.description:
The Synoptic Gospels and the Gospel of John each have a unique presentation of Jesus
Christ.

4344A96E4ACB45D897B6F9F41777EDF6.description: THE FOUR GOSPELS PROCLAIM THE LIFE, MINISTRY, MIRACLES AND TEACHINGS OF JESUS CHRIST.

7416668A4A184C238EB5938D44127286.description:
The development of the New Testament canon resulted in 27 books. The four Gospels in the New Testament canon have commonalities between them and particularities that make
each unique.

CE83687EAA5D4EF581A436D229236B50.description: The Gospel writers, the Evangelists, were inspired by God the Holy Spirit to write the good news of our salvation.

62C0E8AC45BB4A9E9A01584F5E710FA1.description: THE HUMAN AUTHORS OF THE NEW TESTAMENT DEPEND PRIMARILY ON ORAL TRADITION ABOUT JESUS CHRIST AND HIS

0472385788354721B03259992A66E21E.description:
In Jesus Christ there is a unity of human nature and divine nature in the one divine person
of the Son. God the Son is consubstantial with the Father.

656A51DCC5D0472680495D5C9594E468.description: In the Mystery of the Incarnation God the Son, the Word, became fully human without loss 1.1.1 of His Godhead.

84110C7633AC413F85869B13198BAB7F.description: JESUS CHRIST IS TRUE GOD AND TRUE MAN.

F93433249906427B93421FD012134BF1.description: The Mystery of the Blessed Trinity is the center of Christian life and belief.

217D34DCB64C4C79AEE2FF1674E9D152.description: In the relational names of the persons the Father is related to the Son, the Son to the Father, and the Holy Spirit to both. While they are called three persons in view of their relations, we believe in one nature or substance.

90DCB9E477FD4BA5882FCF9AB96044AE.description:
JESUS CHRIST REVEALS THE INTER LIFE OF THE BLESSED TRINITY. GOD IS THREE EQUAL PERSONS, ONE DIVINE
NATURE OR GODHEAD.

358DB9BCD0324C398A22181D6347793D.description: Christ is a translation into Greek from the Hebrew Messiah, which means "anointed". It became the name proper to Jesus because he accomplished perfectly the divine mission of priest, prophet, and King, signified by his anointing as Messiah, "Christ".

1F0E440114E64947AF79BEAE9208E83E.description: Messiah is a Hebrew word meaning "anointed".

60AECBF657934F5387C2F51A5F72F432.description: THE TITLE MESSIAH OR CHRIST MEANS ANOINTED ONE. THIS IS A TITLE AND ROLE, NOT A NAME.

C4EA3A3C0B2243F997E3E20605FD4ECA.description: Jewish culture during the time of Jesus Christ had many elements and components.

9E0337C90F804A1583EB64EAA2712476.description:
The New Testament mentions several historical cities and places, as well as geographical
features that can be located on a map.

5DCAD2B3C87E4A2AB4D92C0BF7075CC3.description: JESUS CHRIST WAS RAISED IN NAZARETH AND WAS AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF HIS RELIGIOUS AND CULTURAL COMMUNITY.

0D11803D97D54679A4FD40BA27E1B991.description: Mary is the Ever-Virgin Mother of God.

8A284DA2A41A4C7FA53E801AD7AE5868.description:
MARY COOPERATED IN GOD'S PLAN FOR SALVATION. MARY'S FIAT AT ANNUNCIATION WAS HER UNCONDITIONAL YES TO
BECOMING THE MOTHER OF GOD.

7AF58F4FF0EB4D91A7B1777002B72E1C.description: God sent his Son born of The Blessed Virgin Mary through which we became his adopted children.

DD8592C6D3FE40ACA74A387496AC9FB6.description: THE ONLY BEGOTTEN SON OF GOD WAS BORN OF WOMAN THROUGH WHOM WE BECAME HIS ADOPTED CHILDREN.

33D39C7B017741419D394C438A3A3CC2.description:
There are present in the Old Testament Scriptures types and prophecies regarding the ,
Promised Savior.

4385519FBADE43E38A20AAA7797A1838.description:
IN HIS PROVIDENCE, THROUGH THE HISTORY OF THE CHOSEN PEOPLE, IN TYPES (PRE-FIGUREMENTS) AND PROPHECY,
GOD PROMISES A REDEEMER.

C839D64C6EF84325B2E8EA2871C5E1E7.description:
As a consequence of Original Sin man lost the grace of original holiness, and became subject to the law of death; sin became universally present in the world. Human nature is
described as being in a fallen state.

B4B11BC0299A4343BCA47AA3F92AFBD1.description:
AFTER THE FALL, ALL HUMAN BEINGS STAND IN NEED OF REDEMPTION. THROUGH DISOBEDIENCE HUMANS LOST GOD'S
GRACE.

0B23B7AE390741A8B86663255C91D254.description:
The spiritual principle of human beings is the soul. The soul is the subject of human consciousness and freedom; soul and body together form one unique human nature. Each
human soul is individual and immortal, immediately created by God.

94C2B30EF6FC4594B3FDDB276FEAAA6B.description: The human person has both a physical and a spiritual dimension.

59AA16716F4A46D0842F99CE589DE986.description: Human beings are created with a body and a soul.

5E859F15A53246DEB44732CC377EF283.description: The book of Genesis has two symbolic stories of creation that reveal God as the source of all life.

24E15CDE9E634DB9A1EDFD8B0B734736.description:
ALL THAT EXISTS, BOTH SEEN AND UNSEEN WAS CREATED THROUGH1
THE WORD.

04AA85F604114B15B2FB8D1A844DDEB5.description:
The Canon of Scripture includes 46 books for the Old Testament and 27 for the New
Testament.

FA835D6A993243B59E11CF2C84093F55.description:
SACRED TRADITION AND SACRED SCRIPTURE MAKE UP A SINGLE SACRED DEPOSIT OF THE WORD OF GOD, WHICH IS
ENTRUSTED TO THE CHURCH.

907FEFC83F2D4FB9BAF7B737E4C23501.description:
Several passages in the New Testament teach specifically on the redemption God gives us
through Jesus Christ.

A6EC0E5856024A479076596B962EC444.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE FULL AND FINAL REVELATION OF GOD. HE IS THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD.
